comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: I think this is James C. Garrison, who was a journalist go was thrown into jail for refusing to reveal sources: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=990CE0D7123FE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: ALBANY, New York, Sept. 22 [1913]. -- James C. Garrison, the [NY Governor] Sulzer press agent, who was arrested on the floor of the Assembly for refusing to answer questions after he had charged that four of the Assembly votes for the Sulzer impeachment resolution had been bought, was taken from the county penitentiary this afternoon to Troy on a writ of habeas corpus and produced before Supreme Court Justice Aaron V.S. Cochran, who had issued the writ.

comment.author: 70701226@N00
comment._content:
I'd like to know more about keeper Simon - he looks like a jolly fellow. Does he work for a zoo? Is he an elephant specialist? Or an early sea lion trainer perhaps?

Maybe I've got the wrong end of the stick, and was his name Simon Keeper? I do hope not.
